intro: Spiranthes wightiana, commonly known as the Wight's spiraea, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, spiraling inflorescence of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. Native to the wetlands and marshes of South Asia, it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, grass-like leaves. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important species for wetland ecosystems.
